Module org.example.miniproyecto_3
Package org.example.miniproyecto_3.Controller

Class EndGameController

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Controller.EndGameController
public class EndGameController extends Object
Controller for the End Game screen. Manages the display of the game result and the actions for "Play Again" and "Exit" buttons, including animations and button hover effects.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private Button
    exitButton
    Button that allows the user to exit the application.
    private Button
    playAgainButton
    Button that allows the user to return to the home screen and start a new game.
    private Label
    resultLabel
    Label used to display the result of the game (win or loss).

      Label used to display the result of the game (win or loss).

  • Constructor Details

    • EndGameController

      public EndGameController()

  • Method Details

    • setResult

      public void setResult(boolean playerWon)
      Sets the result message based on whether the player won or lost.
      Parameters:
      playerWon - true if the player won, false otherwise

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller. Configures button actions and applies intro animation and fade effects. This method is called automatically by JavaFX after the FXML elements are loaded.

    • configurePlayAgainButton

      private void configurePlayAgainButton()
      Configures the "Play Again" button to load the Home view when clicked. Loads the HomeView.fxml and sets it as the current scene.

    • configureExitButton

      private void configureExitButton()
      Configures the "Exit" button to close the application window when clicked.

    • applyIntroAnimation

      private void applyIntroAnimation()
      Applies an introductory scale and fade-in animation to the result label. The animation grows the label from zero size to full size with easing, and fades it from transparent to fully visible.

    • applyFadeEffect

      private void applyFadeEffect(Button btn)
      Applies a continuous fade animation to the given button, making it fade between full opacity and half opacity indefinitely. Also adds mouse enter/exit handlers to scale the button slightly for hover effect.
      Parameters:
      btn - the Button to apply the fade and hover animations to
